DataElement.preferredDefinition: The result of an evaluation to determine whether any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom was temporally associated with the medical treatment or procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Result or outcome of an adverse event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: A phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the outcome or resolution of the patient's adverse events.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created to support CTMS v.3.02 (and subsequent versions) reporting requirements.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._The result of an action.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Adverse Event Contributory to Cause of Death
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any adverse event contributing to the cause of death.

Concepts.longName: Adverse Event Contributory to Cause of Death
Concepts.definition: Any adverse event contributing to the cause of death.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The adverse event did not directly contribute to the death of the subject.

Concepts.definition: The adverse event did not directly contribute to the death of the subject.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event has not improved or recuperated.

Concepts.definition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event has not improved or recuperated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome where the subject recuperated and is free of any pathological conditions resulting from the prior disease or injury.

Concepts.longName: Recovered from Adverse Event without Sequelae
Concepts.definition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome where the subject recuperated and is free of any pathological conditions resulting from the prior disease or injury.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome where the subject recuperated but retained pathological conditions resulting from the prior disease or injury.

Concepts.longName: Recovered from Adverse Event with Sequelae
Concepts.definition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome where the subject recuperated but retained pathological conditions resulting from the prior disease or injury.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 10/10/23 changed Long Name from "Not Stated" to match NCIt Preferred name and current caDSR concept Long Name of "Not Reported" per Brenda.Janice . LS

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
